channel.title: How to add items to a client?
channel.description:
I have a client i use... but the server has some items that my client doesnt have...turns up as a null...
How do i add the items to my client?

item.title: How to add items to a client?
item.dc:creator: @rune-pure rune-pure
item.description:
@rune-pure wrote:

thepker13:

ARE U MAKING A CLIENT A FIRST TIME? IF SO CAN I JOIN IT ILL HELP U WITH SOME CODING SO WHAT DO U SAY

Every one thanks also

GTFO PKER!

YOUR A NOBO AT CODING AND YOUVE BEEN SPAMING UP MY HELP THREADS WITH THIS USELESS SHIT!

sorry for words but meh

item.title: How to add items to a client?
item.dc:creator: @grimreaper61 grimreaper61
item.description:
@grimreaper61 wrote:

class8 is in the client and allows for item recolors. Just change the null to something else in the class8 file.

Read full topic
item.source: How to add items to a client?

item.title: How to add items to a client?
item.dc:creator: @Godsent Godsent
item.description:
@Godsent wrote:

Add this in Itemdef class:

if(i == 9000) {
itemDef.actions = new String[5]
itemDef.actions[1] = "Wear";
itemDef.modifiedModelColors = new int[4];
itemDef.originalModelColors = new int[4];
itemDef.modifiedModelColors = new int[4];
itemDef.originalModelColors = new int[4];
itemDef.modifiedModelColors[0] = 57280;
itemDef.originalModelColors[0] = 926;
itemDef.modifiedModelColors[1] = 54503;
itemDef.originalModelColors[1] = 926;
itemDef.modifiedModelColors[2] = 54183;
itemDef.originalModelColors[2] = 926;
itemDef.modifiedModelColors[3] = 11200;
itemDef.originalModelColors[3] = 926;
itemDef.modelID = 4158; //Inv & Ground
itemDef.modelZoom = 2000; //Zoom
itemDef.modelRotation1 = 572;
itemDef.modelRotation2 = 0;
itemDef.anInt204 = 0;
itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;
itemDef.modelOffset2 = 1;
itemDef.anInt165 = 4181; //Male
itemDef.anInt200 = 7178; //Female
itemDef.anInt175 = -1;
itemDef.anInt197 = -1;
itemDef.name = "Attack Cape";
itemDef.description = "rawr".getBytes();

You’ll get errors I assure you. But you have the basic idea.

Read full topic
